00037 #include <stdio.h>
00038 #include <stdlib.h>
00039 #include <sys/types.h>
00040 #include <sys/stat.h>
00041 #include <errno.h>
00042 #include <string.h>
00043 #include <fcntl.h>
00044 #include <getopt.h>
00045 #include <unistd.h>
00046 #include <time.h>
00047 #include <limits.h>
00048 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00049 
00050 #include <lustre_ioctl.h>
00051 
00052 struct option longopts[] = {
00053         {"ea", 0, 0, 'e'},
00054         {"lookup", 0, 0, 'l'},
00055         {"random", 0, 0, 'r'},
00056         {"stat", 0, 0, 's'},
00057         {NULL, 0, 0, 0},
00058 };
00059 char *shortopts = "ehlr:s0123456789";
00060 
00061 static int usage(char *prog, FILE *out)
00062 {
00063         fprintf(out,
00064                 "Usage: %s [-r rand_seed] {-s|-e|-l} filenamebase total_files iterations\n"
00065                "-r : random seed\n"
00066                "-s : regular stat() calls\n"
00067                "-e : open then GET_EA ioctl\n"
00068                "-l : lookup ioctl only\n", prog);
00069         exit(out == stderr);
00070 }
00071 
00072 #ifndef LONG_MAX
00073 #define LONG_MAX (1 << ((8 * sizeof(long)) - 1))
00074 #endif
00075 
00076 int main(int argc, char ** argv)
00077 {
00078         long i, count, iter = LONG_MAX, mode = 0, offset;
00079         long int start, length = LONG_MAX, last;
00080         char parent[4096], *t;
00081         char *prog = argv[0], *base;
00082         int seed = 0, rc;
00083         int fd = -1;
00084 
00085         while ((rc = getopt_long(argc, argv, shortopts, longopts, NULL)) != -1) {
00086                 char *e;
00087                 switch (rc) {
00088                 case 'r':
00089                         seed = strtoul(optarg, &e, 0);
00090                         if (*e) {
00091                                 fprintf(stderr, "bad -r option %s\n", optarg);
00092                                 usage(prog, stderr);
00093                         }
00094                         break;
00095                 case 'e':
00096                 case 'l':
00097                 case 's':
00098                         mode = rc;
00099                         break;
00100                 case '0':
00101                 case '1':
00102                 case '2':
00103                 case '3':
00104                 case '4':
00105                 case '5':
00106                 case '6':
00107                 case '7':
00108                 case '8':
00109                 case '9':
00110                         if (length == LONG_MAX)
00111                                 length = rc - '0';
00112                         else
00113                                 length = length * 10 + (rc - '0');
00114                         break;
00115                 case 'h':
00116                         usage(prog, stdout);
00117                 case '?':
00118                         usage(prog, stderr);
00119                 }
00120         }
00121 
00122         if (optind + 2 + (length == LONG_MAX) != argc) {
00123                 fprintf(stderr, "missing filenamebase, total_files, or iterations\n");
00124                 usage(prog, stderr);
00125         }
00126 
00127         base = argv[optind];
00128         if (strlen(base) > 4080) {
00129                 fprintf(stderr, "filenamebase too long\n");
00130                 exit(1);
00131         }
00132 
00133         if (seed == 0) {
00134                 int f = open("/dev/urandom", O_RDONLY);
00135 
00136                 if (f < 0 || read(f, &seed, sizeof(seed)) < sizeof(seed))
00137                         seed = time(0);
00138                 if (f > 0)
00139                         close(f);
00140         }
00141 
00142         printf("using seed %u\n", seed);
00143         srand(seed);
00144 
00145         count = strtoul(argv[optind + 1], NULL, 0);
00146         if (length == LONG_MAX) {
00147                 iter = strtoul(argv[optind + 2], NULL, 0);
00148                 printf("running for %lu iterations\n", iter);
00149         } else
00150                 printf("running for %lu seconds\n", length);
00151 
00152         start = last = time(0);
00153 
00154         t = strrchr(base, '/');
00155         if (t == NULL) {
00156                 strcpy(parent, ".");
00157                 offset = -1;
00158         } else {
00159                 strncpy(parent, base, t - base);
00160                 offset = t - base + 1;
00161         }
00162 
00163         if (mode == 'l') {
00164                 fd = open(parent, O_RDONLY);
00165                 if (fd < 0) {
00166                         printf("open(%s) error: %s\n", parent,
00167                                strerror(errno));
00168                         exit(errno);
00169                 }
00170         }
00171 
00172         for (i = 0; i < iter && time(0) - start < length; i++) {
00173                 char filename[4096];
00174                 int tmp;
00175 
00176                 tmp = random() % count;
00177                 sprintf(filename, "%s%d", base, tmp);
00178 
00179                 if (mode == 'e') {
00180 #if 0
00181                         fd = open(filename, O_RDWR|O_LARGEFILE);
00182                         if (fd < 0) {
00183                                 printf("open(%s) error: %s\n", filename,
00184                                        strerror(errno));
00185                                 break;
00186                         }
00187                         rc = ioctl(fd, LDISKFS_IOC_GETEA, NULL);
00188                         if (rc < 0) {
00189                                 printf("ioctl(%s) error: %s\n", filename,
00190                                        strerror(errno));
00191                                 break;
00192                         }
00193                         close(fd);
00194                         break;
00195 #endif
00196                 } else if (mode == 's') {
00197                         struct stat buf;
00198 
00199                         rc = stat(filename, &buf);
00200                         if (rc < 0) {
00201                                 printf("stat(%s) error: %s\n", filename,
00202                                        strerror(errno));
00203                                 break;
00204                         }
00205                 } else if (mode == 'l') {
00206                         struct obd_ioctl_data data;
00207                         char rawbuf[8192];
00208                         char *buf = rawbuf;
00209                         int max = sizeof(rawbuf);
00210 
00211                         memset(&data, 0, sizeof(data));
00212                         data.ioc_version = OBD_IOCTL_VERSION;
00213                         data.ioc_len = sizeof(data);
00214                         if (offset >= 0)
00215                                 data.ioc_inlbuf1 = filename + offset;
00216                         else
00217                                 data.ioc_inlbuf1 = filename;
00218                         data.ioc_inllen1 = strlen(data.ioc_inlbuf1) + 1;
00219 
00220                         if (obd_ioctl_pack(&data, &buf, max)) {
00221                                 printf("ioctl_pack failed.\n");
00222                                 break;
00223                         }
00224 
00225                         rc = ioctl(fd, IOC_MDC_LOOKUP, buf);
00226                         if (rc < 0) {
00227                                 printf("ioctl(%s) error: %s\n", filename,
00228                                        strerror(errno));
00229                                 break;
00230                         }
00231                 }
00232                 if ((i % 10000) == 0) {
00233                         printf(" - stat %lu (time %ld ; total %ld ; last %ld)\n",
00234                                i, time(0), time(0) - start, time(0) - last);
00235                         last = time(0);
00236                 }
00237         }
00238 
00239         if (mode == 'l')
00240                 close(fd);
00241 
00242         printf("total: %lu stats in %ld seconds: %f stats/second\n", i,
00243                time(0) - start, ((float)i / (time(0) - start)));
00244 
00245         exit(rc);
00246 }
